quote: Advertising works best precisely because we don’t think it works on us.
author: Jean Kilbourne

quote: Facebook's market capitalization is approaching half a trillion dollars. It's because it works great as a persuasion architecture. But the structure of that architecture is the same whether you're selling shoes or whether you're selling politics. The algorithms do not know the difference. The same algorithms set loose upon us to make us more pliable for ads are also organizing our political, personal and social information flows, and that's what's got to change.
author: Zeynep Tufekci
source: We're building a dystopia just to make people click ads

quote: Contemporary surveillance works by sorting people into categories and treating them differently...
author: John Gilliom and Torin Monahan
source: SuperVision: An Introduction to the Surveillance Society

quote: Facebook and Google assert with merit that they are giving users what they want… The same can be said about tobacco companies and drug dealers
author: Jason Rosenstein
title: former developer at Facebook & inventor of the like button
